info.title: FHIR DocumentReference resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns DocumentReferences based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for DocumentReference.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: authenticator
parameters.description: Who/what authenticated the document

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Who and/or what authored the document

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Categorization of document

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Document creation time. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: custodian
parameters.description: Organization which maintains the document

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Human-readable description (title)

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Context of the document  content

parameters.name: event
parameters.description: Main Clinical Acts Documented

parameters.name: facility
parameters.description: Kind of facility where patient was seen

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format/content rules for the document

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Master Version Specific Identifier

parameters.name: indexed
parameters.description: When this document reference created. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Human language of the content (BCP-47)

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Uri where the data can be found

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who/what is the subject of the document

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time of service that is being documented. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: related-id
parameters.description: Identifier of related objects or events

parameters.name: related-ref
parameters.description: Related Resource

parameters.name: relatesto
parameters.description: Target of the relationship

parameters.name: relatesto-relation
parameters.description: Combination of relation and relatesTo

parameters.name: relation
parameters.description: replaces | transforms | signs | appends

parameters.name: securitylabel
parameters.description: Document security-tags

parameters.name: setting
parameters.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: current | superseded | entered-in-error

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Who/what is the subject of the document

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Kind of document (LOINC if possible)

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing DocumentReference based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

delete.description:
The conditional delete interaction allows a client to delete DocumentReference/DocumentReferences based on some selection criteria, rather than by a specific logical id.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of DocumentReferences based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.
